intro: Pseudocladia, commonly known as the false clubmoss, is a genus of vascular plants belonging to the family Lycopodiaceae. It is characterized by its small, scale-like leaves and a stem that often appears club-shaped, giving it its common name. These plants typically grow in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Pseudocladia species are generally evergreen and can be found in temperate regions around the world. They play a role in soil stabilization and provide habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
